reviews.review: супер! просто супер!

Let me try to tell you exactly what you're in for, should you decide to purchase Half-Life 2 and attempt to play through it fully.

From the very first moment, you will find yourself in a hostile world, where a sense of urgency never leaves you, never lets go; where you can feel the gaze of some almighty force at all times, watching you, regarding you, pursuing you; where you feel almost totally alone, like everything is a hazard, and every force you face is insurmountable.

Yet you are Gordon Freeman, theoretical physicist, and that hostile world will be overcome; the gaze of that almighty force will be outrun, averted; and that lonesome road, strewn with hazards, all insurmountable, will be surmounted.

You're the right man in the wrong place—and that can make all the difference in the world.
Un classico,uno dei migliori giochi di sempre!
Хорошая игра)

What more can I say that hasn't already been said? Half-Life 2 is the type of shooter that we do not see anymore. In an industry competing for who can have the most explosions and 10 year olds screaming, it is a breath of fresh air to play this game and notice all of the important things that are missing from most first-person shooters: atmosphere, level design, and most importantly, fun. Half-Life 2 manages to nail all three of these aspects and much more. A linear shooter, yes, but it has enough deviations from the typical FPS tropes to provide players with a unique experience that doesn't hold your hand to the next checkpoint. Graphically it is not up to par with today's major releases, but with an engine that has aged so well as Source, it is hard to put some of today's technologies up against it. Physics are still excellent, facial animations are terrific, and the overall art design, couple with the music, give the game a real sense of this strange and dystopian atmosphere that you are a part of. As we see some FPS now returning to this formula (e.g. Wolfenstein: The New Order, Bioshock Infinite), the reminder of the influence that this game has had on these newer releases is amazing. Easily my favorite first-person shooter of all time and a must play for anyone looking for a different experience.

First of all, do not take this necessarily as a criticism, because it's necessary for the game's advancement as a whole, but...

This game is so linear that it makes Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess look like Wind Waker or Skyrim. 

And now that I have gotten that off my chest...

WWWRAAGGGHGHGHGHGH THIS GAME IS SO FREAKING AWESOME!!!!

Even though this game is over a decade old, it remains as a shining example to all FPS games that few other game developers have chosen to take advice from. Integrating puzzles, using environmental elements in ways that would make no sense in a predictable FPS game but in a similar IRL situation would make all the sense in the world, is absolutely stunning. Your movements are so responsive, however you move, you move, no questions asked. I haven't even gotten to the storyline yet! This game's plot, not even to mention that of the entire series as a whole, makes your heart race, your head ache, and makes your soul yearn for more. The enemies are so inspired yet so original, the characters so fleshed out yet so mysterious that it leaves you to fill in the gaps with your own theories upon theories whilst Valve keeps delaying Episode 3. I don't even mind how linear it is! I think it's great, because even though you have a clearly defined path, you can get by with a plethora of different ways, you can intelligently sort your way through or you can leeroy jenkins it (and fail) 

And then the sheer sense of righteous heroistic armed solitary vigilantism that this game gives you is amazing. Do you want to take down a totalitarian ruler who controls the world with an iron fist? Do you want to indirectly battle an alien species bent on total domination of the Multiverse? Are you one of those people who, like me, are actively defiant of rule  by military authority, control, fear and oppression? do you want to be the hero of a dystopian story so like and yet unlike any of the novels you read? Do you feel like breaking the age-old motif of militarized shoot-and-run fighting, and want, for once, to play the role of a super-smart theoretical physicist with his uber-badass nerd glasses, throw on a suit of armour and crowbar and gun your way through endless hordes of mindless zombies, weaponized monsters and meatheaded military personnel alike while having to actually use your brain in a First-Person-Shooter? Well, this is the game for you! Play on and marvel at Valve's awesomeness!

Now to ask someone for Episodes 1 and 2 for christmas...

I, which a lot of people will be angry at me. HATE THIS GAME. It's not even good? It may be 10 years old but the graphics are shit. The story is utter crap, its just thrown everywhere I get handed a crowbar and then I go kill things constantly. This game is worse then call of duty, you constantly kill things and thats all you do. Its not diverse at all! You get a couple puzzles here and there but they are extremley easy and really pathetic, and obviously the game's story is not immersive at all! Go here, do that. Do that, go here. It's just repetitive and once again pathetic. People act as if this game changed how they sleep at night? How? I know so many other games that compared to this are better, more fun and actually give you bang for your buck. Some of these are: Pretty much any game on the PS2, GTA series, Red dead redemption, Far cry series, Mortal Kombat, Prototype, Battlefield series, there are so many games that absolutley crush this game and are a lot more fun. Plus how did this redefine shooters? What about DOOM, Red Faction and the original Call of Duty or Battlefield? Or even Duke Nukem? I feel as if everyone is brainwashed with this trashy game. This game is not worth $10 or even $5 its probably worth $1, because its a 1/10 for me.
11/10 would brutally murder countless innocent  species to extincion again.

But even though I walk through the valley of mediocrity and disappointments I will fear no evil publishers, for the Gaben is with me,  your hazard suit and your crowbard, they comfort me.

This game may be over a decade old, but it is still the pinnacle of the FPS genre. With this game, Valve raised the bar to a level that most developers will never be able reach. Even with more advanced technology, design this good isn't soon to be forgotten. 

If you haven't played it, you may be wondering why people are sad and angry that Half-Life 3, or Episode 3, hasn't come out yet. Play it and you'll feel the same way, no doubt.

Soy un chico de 15 años hoy dia, y este fue el primer juego que yo jugue en mi vida. Marcó un antes y un después en mi vida, me introdujo firmemente al mundo de los videojuegos, a este hermoso arte que hay en nuestra imaginación y capacidades. Voy a ir directo al grano ya que este juego es una Obra Maestra y no hay mucho que decir. Por cierto las notas que le voy a dar son tomando en cuenta su salida oficial en 2004, tomando en cuenta los recursos de ese momento.

Gráficos:(10/10)
Sonido:(9.5/10)
Jugabilidad:(10/10)
Innovación:(10/10)

Nota Final: 10 (Sin lugar a dudas, uno de los juegos a competir hasta hoy dia por ser el mejor de la historia)

The Half-Life Series has left a legacy for a reason. Enough said. 

If you're planning on buying the games individually, dont. Search the "Orange Box" on steam and buy it instead. You get the entire series plus Portal, and it comes out cheaper. The Orange Bundle was on sale yesterday for $5 on greenmangaming. Its normally 20 dollars however, which is still a pretty good deal. I think i bought it for $10. so yeah, the bundle can save you some money if you place it on your wishlist and buy it on sale.

Valve умеют делать игры, и это видно. Эту игру должны пройти все, ведь в ней чувствуется старая школа.
